Package game

Class Game

  • java.lang.Object
    • game.Game
  • public class Game
extends java.lang.Object
    Class that will hold the current different states of the game and handle different tasks such as loading new levels.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      void gameOver()
      Called when the player dies in any way (runs out of health or falls of the level).
      void gameWin()
      Called when the player finishes the game (i.e reaches the end of level 6).

      int[] getDefaultPlayerStats()  
      int getLevelNum()  
      Score getScore()  
      BackgroundPanel getView()  
      SuperLevel getWorld()  
      boolean isSaveLoaded()  
      void loadLevel()
      Used to load the next/desired level.
      static void main​(java.lang.String[] args)
      Starts the game by calling the constructor for the Game class.
      void setCurrentLevel​(java.lang.String currentLevel)
      Sets the current level to the one specified in the currentLevel parameter.
      void setLevelNum​(int levelNum)
      Sets the level number to the one specified in the levelNum parameter.
      void setSaveLoaded​(boolean saveLoaded)
      Sets the state of if the current level that is loaded has been saved to the 'Levels' folder or not.
      void setView​(BackgroundPanel view)
      Updates the attached to the world with a new one.
      void setWorld​(SuperLevel world)
      Updates the stored instance of the world to the new world specified in the world parameter.

    • Method Detail

      • main

        public static void main​(java.lang.String[] args)
        Starts the game by calling the constructor for the Game class.
        Parameters:
        args - String array.

      • gameWin

        public void gameWin()
        Called when the player finishes the game (i.e reaches the end of level 6).

      • gameOver

        public void gameOver()
        Called when the player dies in any way (runs out of health or falls of the level).

      • loadLevel

        public void loadLevel()
        Used to load the next/desired level. Also used to load the main menu or level editor.

      • getCurrentLevel

        public java.lang.String getCurrentLevel()
        Returns:
        the current level string.

      • setCurrentLevel

        public void setCurrentLevel​(java.lang.String currentLevel)
        Sets the current level to the one specified in the currentLevel parameter. Used to determine the current level that is loaded.
        Parameters:
        currentLevel - String which identifies the level's name as a String.

      • getLevelNum

        public int getLevelNum()
        Returns:
        the current level mode.

      • setLevelNum

        public void setLevelNum​(int levelNum)
        Sets the level number to the one specified in the levelNum parameter. Used to determine the current level mode (Level 1-6, or Main Menu, or Level Editor, or a user created level).
        Parameters:
        levelNum - Int which specifies the current level mode.

      • getWorld

        public SuperLevel getWorld()
        Returns:
        the current instance of SuperLevel (current world).

      • setWorld

        public void setWorld​(SuperLevel world)
        Updates the stored instance of the world to the new world specified in the world parameter.
        Parameters:
        world - Specifies the current world of type SuperLevel.

      • getView

        public BackgroundPanel getView()
        Returns:
        the view attached to the world.

      • setView

        public void setView​(BackgroundPanel view)
        Updates the attached to the world with a new one.
        Parameters:
        view - Instance of type BackgroundPanel.

      • getDefaultPlayerStats

        public int[] getDefaultPlayerStats()
        Returns:
        the default player stats (health, armour, ammo) as an integer array.

      • getScore

        public Score getScore()
        Returns:
        the instance of the Score class.

      • isSaveLoaded

        public boolean isSaveLoaded()
        Returns:
        the boolean value of if the current level that is loaded has been saved to the 'Levels' folder. This is automatically true if the current level is any of the non-user created ones (Level 1-6).

      • setSaveLoaded

        public void setSaveLoaded​(boolean saveLoaded)
        Sets the state of if the current level that is loaded has been saved to the 'Levels' folder or not.
        Parameters:
        saveLoaded - Boolean value stating whether or not the current level has been saved.
